p: This lineage was established in 1982 from a human hepatocellular carcinoma; it is therefore able to produce a great variety of substances secreted by the human liver ( 58) and has been used in the study of hepatitis C virus, SARS-CoV, and MERS-CoV ( 27, 34, 58, 59). In the context of SARS-CoV-2, this cell line has been used in the study of infection mechanisms ( 23, 39), the cytotoxicity of viruses from human hosts ( 22, 60), and in pharmacological research ( 26, 46, 48).
